Package infodynamics.measures.mixed

Class ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscreteSourceCommon

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.measures.mixed.ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscreteSourceCommon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscreteSource
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscreteKraskov, ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscreteSourceGaussian
    public abstract class ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscreteSourceCommon
extends java.lang.Object
implements ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscreteSource

    This is an abstract calculator to compute the Conditional Mutual Information I(X;D|Z) between a discrete variable D and a vector of continuous variables X, conditioned on another vector of continuous variables Z. It implements common methods for child classes to build on

    These calculators are EXPERIMENTAL -- not properly tested, and not well documented. The intended calling pattern is similar to ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate

    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)

      • computeSignificance

        public EmpiricalMeasurementDistribution computeSignificance​(boolean reorderDiscreteVariable,
                                                            int numPermutationsToCheck)
                                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Compute the significance of the mutual information of the previously supplied observations. We destroy the p(x,d|z) correlations, while retaining the p(x|z) marginals, to check how significant this conditional mutual information actually was. This is in the spirit of Chavez et. al., "Statistical assessment of nonlinear causality: application to epileptic EEG signals", Journal of Neuroscience Methods 124 (2003) 113-128 which was performed for Transfer entropy.
        Specified by:
        computeSignificance in interface ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscreteSource
        Parameters:
        reorderDiscreteVariable - boolean for whether to reorder the discrete variable (true) or the continuous variable (false)
        numPermutationsToCheck -
        Returns:
        the proportion of conditional MI scores from the distribution which have higher or equal MIs to ours.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • computeSignificance

        public EmpiricalMeasurementDistribution computeSignificance​(boolean reorderDiscreteVariable,
                                                            int[][] newOrderings)
                                                     throws java.lang.Exception

        As per computeSignificance(boolean, int) but supplies the re-orderings of the observations of the named variable.

        We provide a simple implementation which would be suitable for any child class, though the child class may prefer to make its own implementation to make class-specific optimisations. Child classes must implement Cloneable for this method to be callable for them, and indeed implement the clone() method in a way that protects their structure from alteration by surrogate data being supplied to it.

        Specified by:
        computeSignificance in interface ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscreteSource
        Parameters:
        reorderDiscreteVariable - boolean for whether to reorder the discrete variable (true) or the continuous variable (false)
        newOrderings - the specific new orderings to use
        Returns:
        the proportion of conditional MI scores from the distribution which have higher or equal MIs to ours.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
